page.title: 18EMPLOYMENT IN THE DEARNE
page.content: The Dearne is a{Coal Mining Area. There were{three pits, Goldthorpe, {Highgate and Barnburgh.}Highgate is now closed. The two remaining pits employ 1346 men. Most of the Coal mined in this area is sent to the Power Stations at Thorpe Marsh and Ferrybridge. To help increase employment in the area a new{Industrial Estate}has been build at Highgate Lane, Goldthorpe. The ten factory units have been subsidised by{Barnsley Council.}So far half the units are occupied. Among them is English Rose, a clothing firm who employ 320 women. Some people are employed in the Lowfield Road furniture factory and local shops and the supermarket. However unemployment in the Dearne area is around 20%.
